intro: Diplotaxis assurgens var. glabrata, commonly known as the smooth synthetum, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has smooth, hairless leaves and thrives in well-drained, sandy soils. It is often found in arid and semi-arid regions, adapting well to dry conditions. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and resilience in challenging environments.
